question: Which of the following actions cannot be taken by the President if a bill is reserved by the governor for the consideration of the President?
option1: He may give his assent to the bill
option2: He may withhold his assent to the bill
option3: He may direct the governor to return the bill for the reconsideration of the state legislature
option4: He may make amendments to the bill
answer: He may make amendments to the bill
explanation: Under Article 201 of the Constitution of India the President has three alternatives: he may give his assent to the bill, he may withhold his assent to the bill, or he may direct the governor to return the bill (if it is not a money bill) for the reconsideration of the state legislature.
